YouTube's VR app arrives on Oculus Go
paragraph: Facebook's standalone Oculus Go headset is getting a huge dose of immersive entertainment courtesy of YouTube VR. Announced at the Oculus Connect 5 event in September, the app is now available for the entry-level device via the Oculus Store.It follows its launch on almost every other leading VR headset, including PlayStation VR, Daydream, HTC Vive, and Samsung Gear VR -- its arrival on the latter also brought with it a new group viewing option that lets you and your pals watch videos together. A casting option that lets you project what you're seeing to mobiles and TVs also recently made the cut (akin to the feature that's already available on the Oculus app). As for the next-generation of Oculus Go headsets, they'll be getting microSD card support, a new night mode and low-power mode.You can turn on your TV without requiring special hardware support.The space telescope has entered eternal sleep.The feature might be limited to live sports at first.The company said it has been dealing with an app 'issue.'It's stepping up its BFR plans instead.
